free_text.Learning outcomes: The objective of this course is to provide the basics required to develop autonomous mobile robots. Both hardware (energy, locomotion, sensors, embedded electronics, system integration) and software (real-time programming, signal processing, control theory, localization, trajectory planning, high-level control) aspects will be tackled. Theory will be deepened by exercises and application to real robots.[br/][br/]
free_text.Content: [li]History of mobile robotics[br/][li]Applications, products and market[br/][li]Sensors[br/][li]Perception, feature extraction[br/][li]Coping with uncertainties[br/][li]Markov localization: Bayesian filter, Monte Carlo localization, extended Kalman filter[br/][li]Navigation: path planning, obstacle avoidance[br/][li]Control architectures and robotic frameworks[br/][li]Current challenges in mobile robotics[br/][li]Locomotion principles and control[br/][li]Embedded electronics
free_text.Type of teaching: Ex cathedra, exercises, work on mobile robots, mini projects, oral presentations

free_text.Objectifs d'apprentissage: L'objectif de ce cours est de donner les bases nécessaires au développement de robots mobiles autonomes. Autant les aspects matériels (énergie, locomotion, capteurs, électronique embarquée, intégration systémique) que les aspects logiciels (programmation temps réel, traitement du signal, automatique, localisation, planification de trajectoire, contrôle) seront abordés. L'assimilation de la théorie sera approfondie par le biais d'exercices effectués avec des robots réels.
